question: Graph 7 compares the 5-year annualized return for 15 mutual funds with the 3-year annualized return for the same funds. The solid line is the line of best fit. <image 1> The number of funds that have equal 3-year and 5-year returns is ____________.
description:
The image is a scatter plot titled "3-Year and 5-Year Annualized Returns for 15 Mutual Funds." It compares the 5-year annualized return (on the y-axis) with the 3-year annualized return (on the x-axis) for 15 mutual funds. Each fund is represented by a diamond-shaped data point on the graph.

The x-axis ranges from 0 to 20%, representing the 3-year annualized return, while the y-axis ranges from 0 to 25%, representing the 5-year annualized return. There are two lines plotted on the graph: a solid line labeled "y = x" and a dashed line labeled "y = 2x."

The solid line "y = x" represents the line of best fit, indicating where the 5-year return equals the 3-year return. Points lying exactly on this line indicate mutual funds whose 3-year and 5-year returns are equal.

Based on the description, the number of funds that have equal 3-year and 5-year returns can be determined by counting the number of data points that lie exactly on the solid line "y = x."
